request_pathways.name: AMHS Authorization to Disclose PHI (2024 V2)
Saratoga Hospital Authorization to Disclose PHI (legacy, 2020)

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (system-wide, Albany Med Health System)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: System-wide PDF authorization form designed for third-party release, with a sidebar mention of MyChart as an alternative; no dedicated patient self-access pathway.

red_flags: $0.75/page fee stated without distinguishing patient access from third-party release — flat per-page fees are generally impermissible for patient access under HIPAA Right of Access
No reference to HIPAA § 164.524 or patient Right of Access on either form
Purpose field may mislead patients into thinking they must justify their own access request
bright_spots: 65 fillable fields on the primary form — comprehensive digital completion without printing
MyChart patient portal mentioned as alternative pathway directly on the form
Granular record-type selection with 13 categories plus Other and Entire Record option
Separate initials for sensitive information categories (HIV, mental health, substance abuse, genetic testing) compliant with NY and federal requirements
Multi-facility coverage on a single form reduces patient confusion across the system
Witness requirement removed from newer system-wide form (was present on legacy form)

findability.rationale: Level 4: Form found easily via web search and accessible from the AMHS Requesting Medical Records page with no bot blocking or login walls; minor indirection due to domain redirect from saratogahospital.org to albanymed.org.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — 65 fillable fields allow complete on-screen form completion, but submission still requires fax, email, or mail rather than an integrated online submit; MyChart portal offers a fully digital alternative.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Page 1 is well-organized with clear sections and granular options, but page 2 is a dense wall of legal text with no visual hierarchy; college-level language; footer typo ('Dislcose'); no standalone instructions.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is not addressed — both forms are structured entirely as third-party release authorizations with no checkbox, section, or language for individual access rights; patients must list themselves as the disclosure recipient.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: $0.75/page fee applied without distinguishing patient access (which HIPAA limits to cost-based fees) from third-party release; no Right of Access language; purpose field may create perceived barrier; but no notarization, witness, or in-person requirement.

overall.summary: Saratoga Hospital offers a technically polished, easily findable system-wide form with excellent fillable-field coverage, but the complete absence of a dedicated patient self-access pathway and a potentially excessive per-page fee hold back the overall patient experience.
